intro: Jacquemontia evolvuloides f. tomentosula, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features heart-shaped, hairy leaves and produces trumpet-shaped, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly texture, which is most pronounced on the stems and leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a notable species in botanical gardens and native plant collections.
